column3:
19 years has passed since the Great Marmara Earthquake,which took place on Aug. 17,1999.
The epicenter of the earthquake was #Gölcük.Nearly all of the buildings collapsed in the city with 7,4 earthquake magnitude.
17,480 people lost their lives.43,953 got injured.
#17Ağustos1999 https://t.co/12k6bFVkIU

The epicenter of the earthquake was…
column3:
19 years has passed since the Great Marmara Earthquake,which took place on Aug. 17,1999.
The epicenter of the earthquake was #Gölcük.Nearly all of the buildings collapsed in the city with 7,4 earthquake magnitude.
17,480 people lost their lives.43,953 got injured.
#17Ağustos1999 https://t.co/12k6bFVkIU

I am back in my hometown, which was a beach town, many many years later.  The town was ruined by something--buildings collapsed, streets cracked and in shards--but people survived it anyway and continue living in the ruins as if nothing changed

column2: i opened a bag of walkers cheese and onion crisps today, a little too enthusiastically and the bag went “pop”! and crisps went everywhere, “my god”! i thought, “this is exactly how the victims of 9/11 must’ve felt when their office blew up and the buildings collapsed in smoke”

BBC News - A motorway bridge has collapsed in the northwest Italian city of Genoa, killing at least 35 people as vehicles plummeted to the ground. 
Vehicles and debris fell 148ft on to rail tracks, buildings and a river.

column2: At least 35 people were killed when a motorway bridge collapsed in torrential rains on Tuesday morning over buildings in the northern Italian port city of #Genoa, ANSA news agency cited fire brigade sources as saying. https://t.co/q5bd6CpBya #GenoaBridgeCollapse #PonteMorandi
@Reuters The span collapsed onto two arterial highways, a rail line, and rows of industrial buildings. Narrowly missed an IKEA store. Colossal destruction.

column2:
Genoa,Italy
Morandi road bridge (aka Viadotto Polcevera) collapse after lightning strike.
Death toll: 35 confirmed so far
Collapsed road sections have fallen on top of industrial buildings /offices.
Controversial building techniques were used in it's construction in 1967 
#Genova
